title: Riad Turk, the 'Syrian Mandela', dead at 93 in France
description: The dissident fled to France in 2018 after being exfiltrated out of Syria by militants into neighboring Turkey. In total, he spent 17 years imprisoned in Syria, often without trial, on claims of various offenses under Hafez al-Assad and later his son Bashar.

title: In Japan, a trial rekindles criticism of 'hostage justice' system
description: The Tokyo Metropolitan Police and Public Prosecutor's Office have been convicted of fabricating evidence to prosecute the executives of a major company.

title: PSG sign Brazilian 'Joker' Lucas Beraldo
description: The 20-year-old signed a five-year contract with Paris Saint-Germain, ending a three-year stay at Sao Paulo with whom he won the 2023 Copa do Brasil.

title: Israel's top court strikes down key component of Netanyahu's judicial overhaul
description: The Supreme Court voted on Monday to overturn a law passed in July that prevents judges from overturning government decisions they deem 'unreasonable.'

title: Kosovo joins Europe's visa-free Schengen zone
description: The EU's visa-free scheme allowing Kosovars to travel to the Schengen zone for periods of up to 90 days came into force on Monday, seen as another step for the country towards full recognition.

title: DRC elections: Félix Tshisekedi's large and already disputed victory
description: The incumbent president was re-elected for a second term, according to the results issued on Sunday by the Electoral Commission. His main opponents have already announced their rejection of the December 20 election verdict.

title: Las Vegas, American high-speed rail's latest hope
description: President Joe Biden will put $8.2 billion in funding to develop high-speed rail lines. However, the recent history of American railroad projects so far is mostly one of failure and disappointment.

title: Paris 2024: Olympic venues are overall delivered on schedule
description: Solideo, the company set up to build or renovate the facilities for the competition in record time, has generally met its deadline, delivering 84% of the projects.

title: In New Year's Eve address, Macron insists on need to turn the page on year of crises
description: In a 13-minute televised address, Macron said he intends to 'keep acting' in 2024, to renew 'French pride' and lead the campaign for the European elections.

title: New Year's Eve: From Sydney to the Champs-Elysées, the festivities in pictures
description: All over the world, crowds gathered to bid farewell to a year marked by climate and geopolitical crises.

title: Major quakes hit Japan prompting tsunami warnings
description: Japan's government said no abnormalities had been reported in nuclear plants after the series of quakes shook central Japan.

title: North Korea's Kim says military should 'annihilate' US, South Korea if provoked
description: In a party meeting last week, Kim Jong Un said he will launch three more military spy satellites, produce more nuclear materials and develop attack drones this year.

title: Slovenia's zero-waste pioneers
description: The country's second-largest tourist destination after Ljubljana, Bled is the first European town to be awarded 'Zero Waste Cities' certification for its proactive policy to combat waste and pollution.

title: Israel-Hamas war: South Africa brings 'genocide' case before international courts
description: Pretoria has asked the judges of the International Court of Justice to order Israel to cease its operations in the Gaza Strip.

title: Antwerp prepares for life without Russian diamonds
description: From January 1, (non-industrial) diamonds mined or processed in Russia will be banned from the European Union. It's a major blow for the Belgian city, the hub of this precious stone.

title: Macron's friendship with France's chief rabbi causes controversy
description: The December Hanukkah celebration held at the Elysée Palace sparked a fierce debate over the French President's long-standing friendship with Chief Rabbi Haïm Korsia.

title: For Chinese comedians, censorship is no joke
description: In China, stand-up comedians are required to submit their scripts in advance to the Cultural Bureau, avoiding subjects that could upset the regime, or risk sanctions.

title: US Navy helicopters fire at Yemen's Houthi rebels and kill several in latest Red Sea shipping attack
description: This latest attack, the 23rd in the area, is the first time the US Navy said its personnel had killed Houthi fighters since unrest in the Red Sea began
